summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Western Union Financial Services, Inc., dated August 16, 2019, demanding financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena seeks all available information on money transfers and money orders associated with Maxwell's identifiers, with a requested appearance date of August 30, 2019, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, signing the cover letter and the subpoena itself.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena specifically requests all available information regarding money transfers and money orders for her identifiers (name, DOB, SSN, address, phone, email), indicating she is a central subject of the financial investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is authorizing a grand jury investigation into Maxwell's financial transactions, as evidenced by the subpoena targeting her records.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena to Western Union
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY issues a grand jury subpoena to Western Union Financial Services, Inc., demanding financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance/Record Production Deadline
events.description: The subpoena sets this date for Western Union's custodian of records to appear before the grand jury or to produce the requested records to the FBI.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office)
12500 E. Belford Ave, M21A2, Englewood, CO 80112 (Western Union address)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official federal grand jury investigation into suspected felonies, including violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The investigation specifically targets Ghislaine Maxwell's financial transactions through Western Union, seeking all records of money transfers and money orders linked to her personal identifiers.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested Western Union not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.
The document indicates the investigation was active and ongoing as of August 2019, focusing on financial evidence related to alleged criminal activities.
